title: Album Page, "Architectural Details, Bâle", September 27, 1887
medium: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
markings: Paper-maker's mark: embossed in support at lower left corner of sheet: an oval with "J M P" in center, ornament above and a small banner that reads "BRISTOL" below. Note, the side of the mark that has a raised surface is the verso.
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, clockwise from upper right corner: (inscribed in circle) 56 / 68; the beam is about 15 ft... supports / a pretty balcony; Bâle / Sept 27th 1887; top of door filled in wide iron work / very pretty idea / [see next Planche]; chimney top; Belfry  Belfries / gilt gilt.
description: Vertical sheet with five sketches of architectural details.  Depicted in the upper half of the sheet are two belfries, each with a gilt ball finial, as noted by the artist.  Below this at left is a chimney top with two rows of openings topped by a small pitched, tile roof.  At bottom left is a doorway framed by quoins.  At right is balcony with balustrade viewed from below.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Architectural Details, Bâle", September 27, 1887.
September 27, 1887. Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-136.
